ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Autoimmune Inner Ear Disease (AIED)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: The clinical presentation of bilateral, asymmetric, rapidly progressive SNHL with vestibular involvement, elevated ESR, and systemic autoimmune signs (episcleritis) strongly supports AIED. The positive response to immunosuppressive therapy confirms this diagnosis.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Idiopathic Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss (ISSHL)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: While the initial right ear loss fits the criteria for ISSHL, the subsequent involvement of the contralateral ear and systemic markers point to an underlying autoimmune etiology rather than a simple idiopathic event.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Meniere's Disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Symptoms of vertigo, tinnitus, and aural fullness overlap with Meniere's, but the rapid progression to anacusis and the high ESR are more consistent with AIED.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess word recognition abilities and functional hearing status.
To rule out non-organic hearing loss given the unilateral presentation.
To evaluate middle ear function and rule out conductive pathology.
To assess retrocochlear function; absence in the right ear and presence in the left helps localize the lesion.
To investigate specific immune activity (e.g., anti-HSP70 antibodies) associated with AIED.
To screen for inflammatory or autoimmune markers; elevated ESR is a key diagnostic indicator for AIED.
To assess peripheral vestibular function given the history of severe vertigo and unsteadiness.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Right ear anacusis and left ear mild SNHL with right peripheral vestibular deficit.

proposed_items: Medical management with corticosteroids (Prednisone) and immunosuppressants (Cytoxan) to stabilize hearing
Trial of BiCROS hearing aids (initially considered for single-sided deafness)
Fit monaural BTE hearing aid for the left ear (patient preference over BiCROS)
Use of assistive listening devices (FM system) for difficult listening situations
Vestibular rehabilitation strategies for balance compensation
counseling_actions: Educate on the urgency of reporting any sudden changes in the 'good' ear immediately
Discuss realistic expectations regarding localization and speech-in-noise difficulties due to single-sided deafness
Advise on safety precautions (nightlights, visual cues) to compensate for vestibular loss
Counsel on stress management and the impact of chronic autoimmune conditions on hearing

red_flags_present: Elevated ESR and systemic autoimmune signs (episcleritis)

escalation.rationale_short: AIED requires aggressive medical management to prevent total deafness; sudden drops are medical emergencies.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Immediate medical review during fluctuations; routine audiological monitoring every 6-12 months.
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor thresholds in the only hearing ear to guide medical dosage and adjust amplification.

expected_outcome: Preservation of functional hearing in the left ear through medical management, despite some long-term decline.
Permanent profound hearing loss (anacusis) in the right ear.
Successful use of monaural amplification and communication strategies.
Adaptation to vestibular deficit with visual compensation.
